intro: Senecio rutshuruensis, commonly known as the Rutshuru groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, forested areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
